content.description: This stunning line is hard to miss! Follow the discontinuous crack feature directly up the steep center of the buttress. Moves are hard, insecure, and very technical; gear is sparse and small. Top out a small ledge, take in the view and reward yourself with a glorious easy flake to the anchor.
content.location: Center of the right side of the buttress.

content.description: Fun crack that goes through a lot of sizes, thin hands, big hands, fists, and chimney. Start up the wide broken cracks to a thin hand crack at the end. Climb is broken up by various ledges with some nice crack climbing. When pulling the rope make sure to give it a yank and the end so it doesn't get stuck in the bushes/rocks on the ledge.
content.protection: Gear to 4" (could get away with just #3's if your confident in chimney's)
content.location: Crack system to the right of ripple.

climbs.name: Hard Crack
climbs.fa: Tai and Mary DeVore, Jeremy Freeman, 2018

content.description: Scramble up the ledge and crank hard on this funky crack. It looks deceptively straight forward, but as the name suggests, it ain't.
content.location: Left most splitter crack on the left side of the Buttress.

climbs.name: Center Crack
climbs.fa: Dan Shively, Tai DeVore, Jeremy Freeman, 2013

content.description: Scramble up the ledge and climb the center crack system (of the three crack systems on the left side of the buttress). This excellent climb has it all - bomber hands, easy chimney, airy moves, funky roof and glorious jugs. Finish up atop a blocky ledge at a lower-off anchor.
content.location: Middle crack of the three crack systems on the left side of te buttress. Scramble up the same sloping ledge as for Hard Crack (5.12) and Wide Crack (5.10).
